result.execSummary:
The defendant George M Lowrimore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
AODA and comply.  Submit DNA sample.  May report to probation by noon on 4-6-16.

records.addlTxt: Columbia County Court Conviction DNA - conviction DNA on file

Defendant George M Lowrimore in court with attorney Joseph L Viney.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 15CF483, 15TR5907, and 15TR6862.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled guilty to 15TR5907 and guilty to 15CF483 Ct. 1.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  In 15TR5907 Court sentenced defendant to pay $761.50 fines/costs.  6 mo. DL revocation. No IID is required.  AODA and comply.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  In 15CF483 Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 2 years.  Conditions of probation include: $518.00 costs.  AODA and comply.  Submit DNA sample.  Ct. 2 Dismissed but read in.  15TR6862 dismissed.  May report to probation tomorrow by noon.
amending bond conditions for defendant to travel to Ft. Myers, Florida from 2/5/16 through February 20, 2016 for employment

Defendant George M Lowrimore in court with attorney Joseph L Viney.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Viney states there is a stipulation for defendant to travel to Ft. Meyers, Florida from 2/5/16 - 2/20/16 for employment, Court approves stipulation, Waiver of Right to Prelim filed, Court accepts Waiver, probable cause found, bound over, Information filed, waives reading, stands mute, not guilty pleas entered, Atty Viney requesting plea/sentencing, 15 TR 5907 and 15 TR 6862 to track,  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by  ADA Crystal Long

Not operate motor vehicle without a valid license.  Not to possess any controlled substances without a valid Rx.  Standard felony conditions.

Defendant George M Lowrimore in court with attorney Joseph L Viney.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $2000.00 signature bond.  Not operate motor vehicle without a valid license.  Not to possess any controlled substances without a valid Rx.  Standard felony conditions.  Defendant waived time limits for preliminary hearing.  Plead not guilty to 15TR5907.  It will track with this case.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 03:20 pm.  Return date scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
